problem: A particle moves so that it is at $(2t + 7, 4t - 13)$ at time $t.$  Find the speed of the particle, measured in unit of distance per unit of time.

step.text: That's right. So the velocity vector is $(2, 4)$.
previous_steps: For a particle moving in two dimensions, we can find the speed by finding the magnitude of the velocity vector.
Recall that the velocity vector is the derivative of the position vector.
